Error in temperature rising of Fixing Assembly
The temperature of the Fixing Assembly did not reach a certain temperature within the specified time after starting temperature control.

1. Check the harness/connector between the Fixing Assembly and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 2. Check the harness/connector between the Fixing Assembly and the Fixing Power Supply PCB (UN3). 3. Check the harness/connector between the Fixing Power Supply PCB (UN3) and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 4. Replace the Fixing Assembly. 5. Replace the Fixing Power Supply PCB (UN3). 6. Replace the Low Voltage Power Supply PCB (UN2). 7. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
Abnormal high temperature of the Fixing Assembly
It was detected that the temperature of the Fixing Assembly (Main Thermistor) (TH801) was abnormally high.

1. Check the harness/connector between the Fixing Assembly and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 2. Check the harness/connector between the Fixing Assembly and the Fixing Power Supply PCB (UN3). 3. Check the harness/connector between the Fixing Power Supply PCB (UN3) and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 4. Replace the Fixing Assembly. 5. Replace the Fixing Power Supply PCB (UN3). 6. Replace the Low Voltage Power Supply PCB (UN2). 7. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
Abnormal high temperature of the Fixing Assembly
It was detected that the temperature of the Fixing Assembly (Sub Thermistor) (TH802/TH803) was abnormally high.

1. Check the harness/connector between the Fixing Assembly and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 2. Check the harness/connector between the Fixing Assembly and the Fixing Power Supply PCB (UN3). 3. Check the harness/connector between the Fixing Power Supply PCB (UN3) and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 4. Replace the Fixing Assembly. 5. Replace the Fixing Power Supply PCB (UN3). 6. Replace the Low Voltage Power Supply PCB (UN2). 7. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
Abnormal low temperature of the Fixing Assembly
It was detected that the temperature of the Fixing Assembly (main Thermistor) (TH801) was abnormally low.

1. Check the harness/connector between the Fixing Assembly and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 2. Check the harness/connector between the Fixing Assembly and the Fixing Power Supply PCB (UN3). 3. Check the harness/connector between the Fixing Power Supply PCB (UN3) and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 4. Replace the Fixing Assembly. 5. Replace the Fixing Power Supply PCB (UN3). 6. Replace the Low Voltage Power Supply PCB (UN2). 7. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
Abnormal low temperature of the Fixing Assembly
It was detected that the temperature of the Fixing Assembly (Sub Thermistor) (TH802/TH803) was abnormally low.

1. Check the harness/connector between the Fixing Assembly and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 2. Check the harness/connector between the Fixing Assembly and the Fixing Power Supply PCB (UN3). 3. Check the harness/connector between the Fixing Power Supply PCB (UN3) and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 4. Replace the Fixing Assembly. 5. Replace the Fixing Power Supply PCB (UN3). 6. Replace the Low Voltage Power Supply PCB (UN2). 7. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
Error in fixing power supply drive circuit
The zero cross signal was not detected for the specified period of time or longer.

1. Check the harness/connector between the Engine Controller PCB (UN1) and the Thermistor (TH801/TH802/TH803). 2. Check the harness/connectors between the Fixing Assembly and the Fixing Power Supply PCB (UN3). 3. Check the harness/connector between the Fixing Power Supply PCB (UN3) and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 4. Replace the Fixing Assembly. 5. Replace the Fixing Power Supply PCB (UN3). 6. Replace the Low Voltage Power Supply PCB (UN2). 7. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
Revolution of the Drum Motor (M2) did not reach the specified value

1. Check the harness/connector between the Drum Motor (M2) and the Driver PCB (UN11). 2. Check the harness/connectors between the Driver PCB (UN11) and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 3. Replace the Drum Motor (M2). 4. Replace the Driver PCB (UN11). 5. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
Revolution of the Drum Motor (M2) was out of the specified range.

1. Check the harness/connector between the Drum Motor (M2) and the Driver PCB (UN11). 2. Check the harness/connectors between the Driver PCB (UN11) and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 3. Replace the Drum Motor (M2). 4. Replace the Driver PCB (UN11). 5. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
Error in startup of the Fixing motors
Revolution of the Fixing Motor (M4) did not reach the specified value.

1. Check the harness/connector between the Fixing Motor (M4) and the Driver PCB (UN11). 2. Check the harness/connector between the Driver PCB (UN11) and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 3. Replace the Fixing Motor (M4). 4. Replace the Driver PCB (UN11). 5. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
Revolution of the Fixing Motor (M4) did not reach the specified value.

1. Check the harness/connector between the Fixing Motor (M4) and the Driver PCB (UN11). 2. Check the harness/connector between the Driver PCB (UN11) and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 3. Replace the Fixing Motor (M4). 4. Replace the Driver PCB (UN11). 5. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
The error was detected after the development disengagement operation.

The error is likely caused by failure of the Developing Disengagement Solenoid (K) (SL2) / Developing Disengagement Solenoid (YMC) (SL4) or the Developing Disengagement Switch (K) (SW3) / Developing Disengagement Switch (YMC) (SW2). 1. Check the harness/connector between the Developing Disengagement Solenoid (K) (SL2) / Developing Disengagement Solenoid (YMC) (SL4) and the Driver PCB (UN11), and the harness/ connector between the Developing Disengagement Switch (K) (SW3) / Developing Disengagement Switch (YMC) (SW2) and the Driver PCB (UN11).2. Check the harness/connector between the Driver PCB (UN11) and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).3. Replace the Developing Disengagement Switch (K) (SW3) or the Developing Disengagement Switch (YMC) (SW2).4. Replace the Developing Disengagement Solenoid (K) (SL2) or the Developing Disengagement Solenoid (YMC) (SL4).5. Replace the Driver PCB (UN11).6. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).

After lift-up of the Lifting Plate of the cassette of the host machine started, ON status of the Paper Surface Sensor of the cassette of the host machine was not detected within the specified period of time.

1. While the cassette of the host machine is removed, turn ON the power and insert the cassette, then check the operation sound of the Lifter Motor.When there is operation sound of the Lifter Motor, check if the Lifting Plate has been lifted up.<When the Lifting Plate has been lifted up>1. Check the harness/connector between the Cassette Feeder Driver PCB (UN20) and the Cassette Paper Surface Sensor (SR32) of the host machine.2. Replace the Cassette Paper Surface Sensor (SR32).3. Replace the Cassette Feeder Driver PCB (UN20).4. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).<When the Lifting Plate has not been lifted up>1. Check the condition of the gear at the host machine side (missing teeth, swing). 2. Check the harness/connector between the Lifter Solenoid (SL5) and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).3. Check the harness/connector between the Pickup Motor (M1) and the Driver PCB (UN11). 4. Check the harness/connector between the Driver PCB (UN11) and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 5. Replace the Lifter Solenoid (SL5) 6. Replace the Pickup Motor (M1).7. Replace the Driver PCB (UN11).8. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).<When there is no operation sound of the motor>1. Check the harness/ connector between the Pickup Motor (M1) and the Driver PCB (UN11).2. Check the harness/ connector between the Driver PCB (UN11) and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).3. Replace the Pickup Motor (M1).4. Replace the Driver PCB (UN11).5. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
After lift-up of the Lifting Plate of the 1st Paper Feeder started, ON status of the Paper Surface Sensor of the 1st Paper Feeder was not detected within the specified period of time.

1. While the cassette of the Paper Feeder is removed, turn ON the power and insert the cassette, then check the operation sound of the Lifter Motor.When there is operation sound of the Lifter Motor, check if the Lifting Plate has been lifted up.<When the Lifting Plate has been lifted up>1. Check the harness/connector between the Cassette Feeder Driver PCB (UN20) and the Cassette Paper Surface Sensor (SR32).2. Replace the Cassette Paper Surface Sensor (SR32).3. Replace the Cassette Feeder Driver PCB (UN20).<When the Lifting Plate has not been lifted up>1. Check the condition of the gear of the Paper Feeder (missing teeth, swing). 2. Check the harness/connector between the Lifter Solenoid (SL21) and the Cassette Feeder Driver PCB (UN20). 2. Check the harness/connector between the Cassette Feeder Driver PCB (UN20) and the Pickup Motor(M9).3. Replace the Pickup Motor (M9). 4. Replace the Lifter Solenoid (SL21). 5. Replace the Cassette Feeder Driver PCB (UN20).<When there is no operation sound of the motor>,1. Check the harness/connector between the Cassette Feeder Driver PCB (UN20) and the Pickup Motor (M9)2. Replace the Pickup Motor (M9).3. Replace the Cassette Feeder Driver PCB (UN20).
An error in the Color Displacement/Density Sensor was detected.
1. Check the harness/connector between the RD Sensor (UN7) and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 2. Replace the RD Sensor (UN7). 3. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
It was judged that the Developing Motor did not rotate.

1. Check the harness/connector between the Developing Motor (M3) and the Driver PCB (UN11). 2. Check the harness/connector between the Driver PCB (UN11) and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 3. Replace the Developing Motor (M3). 4. Replace the Driver PCB (UN11). 5. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1)
It was judged that the Developing Motor did not rotate.

1. Check the harness/connector between the Developing Motor (M3) and the Driver PCB (UN11). 2. Check the harness/connector between the Driver PCB (UN11) and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 3. Replace the Developing Motor (M3). 4. Replace the Driver PCB (UN11). 5. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
It was judged that the Developing Motor did not rotate.

1. Check the harness/connector between the Developing Motor (M3) and the Driver PCB (UN11). 2. Check the harness/connector between the Driver PCB (UN11) and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 3. Replace the Developing Motor (M3). 4. Replace the Driver PCB (UN11). 5. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
It was judged that the Developing Motor did not rotate.

1. Check the harness/connector between the Developing Motor (M3) and the Driver PCB (UN11). 2. Check the harness/connector between the Driver PCB (UN11) and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 3. Replace the Developing Motor (M3). 4. Replace the Driver PCB (UN11). 5. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
Error in startup of the Yellow Developing Motor
Revolution of the Developing Motor did not reach the specified value.

1. Check the harness/connector between the Developing Motor (M3) and the Driver PCB (UN11). 2. Check the harness/connector between the Driver PCB (UN11) and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 3. Replace the Developing Motor (M3). 4. Replace the Driver PCB (UN11). 5. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
Error in startup of the Magenta Developing Motor
Revolution of the Developing Motor did not reach the specified value.

1. Check the harness/connector between the Developing Motor (M3) and the Driver PCB (UN11). 2. Check the harness/connector between the Driver PCB (UN11) and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 3. Replace the Developing Motor (M3). 4. Replace the Driver PCB (UN11). 5. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
Error in startup of the Cyan Developing Motor
Revolution of the Developing Motor did not reach the specified value.

1. Check the harness/connector between the Developing Motor (M3) and the Driver PCB (UN11). 2. Check the harness/connector between the Driver PCB (UN11) and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 3. Replace the Developing Motor (M3). 4. Replace the Driver PCB (UN11). 5. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
Error in startup of the Black Developing Motor
Revolution of the Developing Motor did not reach the specified value.

1. Check the harness/connector between the Developing Motor (M3) and the Driver PCB (UN11). 2. Check the harness/connector between the Driver PCB (UN11) and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 3. Replace the Developing Motor (M3). 4. Replace the Driver PCB (UN11). 5. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
Connection of the Duplex Feed Unit was not correct.
An error in the Environment Sensor was detected.

1. Check the harness/connection between the Engine Controller PCB (UN1) and the Environment Sensor PCB (UN10). 2. Replace the Environment Sensor PCB (UN10). 3. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
Primary transfer disengagement mechanism did not work properly.

1. Check the harness/connector between the Primary Transfer Disengagement Switch (SW4) and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 2. Check the harness/connector between the Primary Transfer Disengagement Solenoid (SL30) and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 3. Replace the ITB Unit (including the Primary Transfer Disengagement Switch / Primary Transfer Disengagement Solenoid). 4. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
Error in the Scanner Motor, Laser Scanner Unit, or BD detection in the yellow scanner area was detected.
1. Check the harness/connector between the Laser Scanner Unit and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 2. Replace the Laser Scanner Unit. 3. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
Error in the Scanner Motor, Laser Scanner Unit, or BD detection in the magenta scanner area was detected.
1. Check the harness/connector between the Laser Scanner Unit and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 2. Replace the Laser Scanner Unit. 3. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
Error in the Scanner Motor, Laser Unit, or BD detection in the cyan scanner area was detected.
1. Check the harness/connector between the Laser Scanner Unit and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 2. Replace the Laser Scanner Unit. 3. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
Error in the Scanner Motor, Laser Scanner Unit, or BD detection in the black scanner area was detected.
1. Check the harness/connector between the Laser Scanner Unit and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 2. Replace the Laser Scanner Unit. 3. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
The error is detected when the completion of pseudo BD measurement is not notified within the specified period of time after the pseudo BD generation.
1. Check the harness/connector between the Laser Scanner Unit and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 2. Replace the Laser Scanner Unit. 3. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
Color Displacement/Density Sensor, Color Displacement Sensor error
An error in the Color Displacement/Density Sensor, Color Displacement Sensor were detected.

1. Replace the Toner Cartridge. 2. Check the harness/connector between the Color Displacement/Density Sensor and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 3. Replace the Color Displacement/Density Sensor. 4. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1) 5. Replace the ITB Unit.
Update of the DC Controller failed.
1. Install the set of controller firmware. 2. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
Error in the writing/reading of the main program in the Main Controller PCB (Main ROM)
1. Update the firmware. 2. Replace the Main Controller PCB (UN30).
ROM writing/reading error (Setting values storage ROM)
Error in the writing/reading the setting values storage area in the Main Controller PCB (Setting values storage ROM)
1. Update the firmware. 2. Replace the Main Controller PCB (UN30).
Unable to read/write data from the eMMC. The eMMC failure occurred.
1. Update the firmware. 2. Replace the Main Controller PCB (UN30).
The eMMC was replaced incorrectly. The eMMC failure occurred.
1. Update the firmware. 2. Replace the Main Controller PCB (UN30).
Error in the nonvolatile memory on the Engine Controller PCB
1. Turn OFF and then ON the power and check if the symptom occurs again. 2. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
The Scanner (CIS) could not detect the home position when starting scanning operation.

1. Check the harnesses/connectors connecting from the Main Controller PCB (UN30) to the CIS Unit HP Sensor (SR11) and the Reader Motor (M5) 2. Replace the CIS HP Sensor (SR11). 3. Replace the Reader Motor (M5). 4. Replace the CIS Unit. 5. Replace the Reader Unit. 6. Replace the Main Controller PCB (UN30).
The Scanner (CIS) could not detect the home position when completing scanning operation.

1. Check the harnesses/connectors connecting from the Main Controller PCB (UN30) to the CIS Unit HP Sensor (SR11) and the Reader Motor (M5) 2. Replace the CIS HP Sensor (SR11). 3. Replace the Reader Motor (M5). 4. Replace the CIS Unit. 5. Replace the Reader Unit. 6. Replace the Main Controller PCB (UN30).
Light intensity of the CIS Unit at the reference level or below
When the light intensity is at the reference level or below at shading.
1. Disconnect and then connect the Flexible Cable. 2. Replace the Flexible Cable. 3. Replace the CIS Unit. 4. Replace the Main Controller PCB (UN30).
Error in access to backup data for the Reader (reading error at power-on)
The Reader-related adjustment values could not be read.
1. Install the set of the controller firmware. 2. Replace the Main Controller PCB (UN30).
1. Update the firmware. 2. Replace the Main Controller PCB (UN30).
Error in communication with the New Card Reader (serial communication)
Unable to communicate with the new Card Reader.
1. Check the connection of the New Card Reader.
1. Install the set of the controller firmware. 2.Replace the Main Controller PCB (UN30).
Communication error between the Engine Controller PCB and the Main Controller PCB occurred.

1. Check the harness/connector connection between the Engine Controller PCB (UN1) and the Main Controller PCB (UN30). 2. Install the set of the controller firmware. 3. Replace the Main Controller PCB (UN30). 4. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
1. Check the connection of the NCU PCB (UN38). 2. Replace the NCU PCB (UN38). 3. Replace the Main Controller PCB (UN30).
Error in ROM for backing up fax data
An error occurred in ROM for backing up fax data.
1. Check the connection of the NCU PCB (UN38). 2. Replace the NCU PCB (UN38). 3. Replace the Main Controller PCB (UN30).
1. Turn OFF and then ON the power.
Incorrect combination of language file versions
Language file version did not match that of the main program.
The size of the language file exceeded the allowed size.
Version mismatch between BOOTABLE and BOOTROM
Version of the main program and that of the start-up program did not mach.
1. Check if the valid Engine Controller PCB (UN1) is installed. 2. Update the firmware. 3. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
Communication error between the Controller PCB and the Main Controller PCB
Communication with the Control Panel PCB could not be established.

1. Check the harness/connector between the Panel PCB (UN31) and the Main Controller PCB (UN30). 2. Replace the Control Panel (including the Panel PCB(UN31)). 3. Replace the Main Controller PCB (UN30).
Communication error with Wireless LAN PCB
Communication with the Wireless LAN PCB could not be established.

1. Turn OFF and then ON the main power. 2. Check the harness/connector connection between the Wireless LAN PCB (UN35) and the Main Controller PCB (UN30) 3. Install the set of the controller firmware. 4. Replace the Wireless LAN PCB (UN35). 5. Replace the Main Controller PCB (UN30).
An error in the microcomputer which retains fax job information of the Main Controller PCB.
1. Update the firmware. 2. Replace the Main Controller PCB (UN30).
A communication error of the Main Controller PCB occurred (other than scan-related communication error).
1. Update the firmware. 2. Replace the Main Controller PCB (UN30).
Information on digital registration could not be obtained.
1. Install the Engine Controller firmware. 2. Install the set of Controller firmware. 3. Replace the Engine Controller (UN1).
Error in power state of the Laser Scanner Unit (firmware-dependent).
1. Update the firmware. 2. Replace the Laser Scanner Unit.
The Cartridge Fan failed to rotate at the specified revolution.
1. Check the connection of the Cartridge Fan (FM2). 2. Replace the Cartridge Fan (FM2).
The Power Supply Fan (power supply) failed to rotate at the specified revolution.
1. Check the connection of the Power Supply Fan. 2. Replace the Power Supply Fan (FM1).
When the printer has detected a low voltage power supply failure.

1. Check the harness/connector between the Engine Controller PCB (UN1) and the Low Voltage Power Supply PCB (UN2). 2. Replace the Low Voltage Power Supply PCB (UN2). 3. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
An error in pressure release mechanism of the Fixing Assembly was detected.

1. Check the harness/connector between the Fixing Pressure Release Switch (SW5) and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 2. Check the harness/connector between the Fixing Motor (M4) and the Driver PCB (UN11). 3. Check the harness/connector between the Driver PCB (UN11) and the Engine Controller PCB (UN1). 4. Replace the Fixing Pressure Release Switch (SW5). 5. Replace the Fixing Motor (M4). 6. Replace the Fixing Assembly. 7. Replace the Driver PCB (UN11). 8. Replace the Engine Controller PCB (UN1).
